text.section:
In a proceeding for an annulment or an absolute divorce, if there is a dispute as to whether certain property is marital property, the court shall determine which property is marital property:
when the court grants an annulment or an absolute divorce;
within 90 days after the court grants an annulment or divorce, if the court expressly reserves in the annulment or divorce decree the power to make the determination; or
after the 90-day period if:
the court expressly reserves in the annulment or divorce decree the power to make the determination;
during the 90-day period, the court extends the time for making the determination; and
the parties consent to the extension.
In this subtitle a military pension shall be considered in the same manner as any other pension or retirement benefit.
